requirement_tested: A frontend interface for customers to input shirt customization details including model, fabric, and measurements
user_persona: A customer named Alex who wants to design a custom shirt for an upcoming event.
user_goal: To successfully enter shirt model, fabric choice, and body measurements into the customization form.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Customization Form
narrative_steps.description: Alex navigates to the shirt customization page and sees a form with sections for model selection, fabric options, and measurements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page displays a multi-section form with a dropdown for shirt models, a grid of fabric swatches, and labeled input fields for measurements, all on a floral white background.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Shirt Model
narrative_steps.description: Alex selects a preferred shirt model from the dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.action: Click the shirt model dropdown and select an option.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The selected model updates the preview area with the base model visualization.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Fabric
narrative_steps.description: Alex browses through available fabrics and clicks on a preferred swatch.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The clicked swatch is highlighted as selected and the preview updates accordingly.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Measurements
narrative_steps.description: Alex begins typing his body measurements into the respective fields.
narrative_steps.action: Type values into measurement input fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Real-time validation feedback appears below each field as Alex types.

requirement_tested: A real-time shirt design generator that creates visual representations based on customer inputs
user_persona: A fashion-conscious customer named Taylor designing a personalized gift.
user_goal: To see a live visual update of the shirt design as customization choices are made.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Design Display
narrative_steps.description: Taylor arrives at the customization page and observes a default shirt design in the preview panel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A central panel shows a default SVG representation of a shirt against a floral white background.

narrative_steps.title: Modifying Inputs
narrative_steps.description: Taylor changes the shirt model, selects a new fabric, and tweaks some measurements.
narrative_steps.action: Modify shirt model, fabric, and measurement inputs.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Debounced requests are sent to the design generation API, updating the SVG in real time with each change.

requirement_tested: A design preview panel allowing customers to view and confirm their customized shirt design
user_persona: Jordan, a meticulous shopper, wants to verify the final look before proceeding.
user_goal: To review the finalized shirt design and confirm it before moving forward.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Design
narrative_steps.description: Jordan examines the generated shirt design in the preview panel and decides it looks perfect.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The panel displays the current shirt SVG centered with a 'Confirm Design' button styled in dark goldenrod below it.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Design
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the design, Jordan clicks the confirmation button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The user is redirected to the order summary page with the confirmed design carried over.

requirement_tested: A dynamic form system that validates customer inputs for shirt customization parameters
user_persona: Casey, a cautious user, wants to ensure all entries are correct before submitting.
user_goal: To submit valid customization details without encountering errors.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Invalid Data
narrative_steps.description: Casey mistakenly enters a negative value in the chest measurement field and moves to the next field.
narrative_steps.action: Enter '-5' in the chest measurement field and blur the field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An inline error message immediately appears below the field indicating the value must be positive.

narrative_steps.title: Correcting Entry
narrative_steps.description: Casey corrects the mistake by entering a valid number.
narrative_steps.action: Change the value to '95' and blur the field again.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The error message disappears and the field is marked as valid.

narrative_steps.title: Attempting Submission
narrative_steps.description: Before selecting a model, Casey tries to proceed to the next step.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to click 'Next' without selecting a model.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Red error messages appear prompting selection of required fields like model and fabric.

requirement_tested: An order management system to process and track customer shirt orders
user_persona: Riley, a frequent shopper, wants to check the status of a recent order.
user_goal: To view and track the progress of an existing shirt order.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Order History
narrative_steps.description: Riley logs in and navigates to the order history section.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the order history page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A table lists Riley's past and current orders with IDs, dates, amounts, and status icons on a floral white background.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Order Details
narrative_steps.description: Riley clicks on a specific order to get more information.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The user is taken to a detailed tracking page showing customization specs, status timeline, and delivery estimate.

requirement_tested: A payment processing integration to handle secure transactions for custom shirt purchases
user_persona: Morgan is ready to complete the purchase of a custom-designed shirt.
user_goal: To securely pay for the custom shirt and receive confirmation.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Payment
narrative_steps.description: Morgan reaches the checkout screen and sees a secure payment form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal overlay titled 'Complete Your Purchase' appears containing PCI-compliant card input fields.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Payment
narrative_steps.description: Morgan fills in card details and clicks the submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form is submitted to the Stripe API. On success, Morgan is redirected to the order confirmation screen; on failure, an error message is shown.

requirement_tested: A backend API layer that connects to a PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
user_persona: DevOps engineer Sam is deploying the application for production use.
user_goal: To ensure the backend properly connects to the PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Sam starts the backend server which should automatically connect to the database.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend establishes a connection to the PostgreSQL database using the environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

requirement_tested: Frontend components that fetch all dynamic data exclusively through backend APIs
user_persona: End-user Pat is browsing the website to customize a shirt.
user_goal: To interact with a fully functional frontend that retrieves dynamic content via backend APIs.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Shirt Models
narrative_steps.description: Pat visits the customization page and expects to see a list of available shirt models loaded dynamically.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The frontend makes an API call to fetch shirt models and populates the dropdown with results instead of hardcoded data.

requirement_tested: Database schema to store customer information, shirt customizations, orders, and payment records
user_persona: Database administrator Quinn ensures data integrity and schema compliance.
user_goal: To validate that all necessary tables and relationships exist in the database.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Tables
narrative_steps.description: Quinn connects to the database to verify that all required tables have been created.
narrative_steps.action: Query the database for table existence.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables such as users, shirt_customizations, orders, and payments are present with appropriate columns and foreign key constraints.

requirement_tested: A color configuration system setting floral white as the global background color
user_persona: Designer Dana wants to ensure brand consistency across the entire site.
user_goal: To confirm that every page uses floral white as the background color.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Dana opens the homepage to check the background color.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire viewport renders with a solid floral white background as defined by the CSS variable :root { --background-color: #fffaf0; }.

requirement_tested: UI component styling framework using dark goldenrod for all interactive elements
user_persona: UX researcher Robin is evaluating the visual consistency of interactive components.
user_goal: To verify that all interactive UI elements use dark goldenrod styling.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Buttons
narrative_steps.description: Robin focuses on various buttons throughout the site to observe their styling.
narrative_steps.action: Focus on different buttons and input fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive elements have dark goldenrod borders and accents, with a subtle glow effect on focus as specified in the stylesheet.

requirement_tested: User authentication and session management for persistent shopping experiences
user_persona: Returning user Blake wants to continue shopping where he left off last time.
user_goal: To log in and access previously saved items and preferences.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Blake clicks the login link and enters his credentials in the modal.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Login', fill in email and password, then submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Credentials are verified via the session management API. On success, the page reloads showing the logged-in UI with Blake's profile avatar.

requirement_tested: Order confirmation and receipt generation functionality
user_persona: New customer Avery just completed her first purchase.
user_goal: To receive a digital receipt and confirmation after placing an order.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Purchase
narrative_steps.description: After payment, Avery is directed to a confirmation screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The order confirmation page displays HTML receipt content inline and an email receipt is sent asynchronously via the SMTP service.

requirement_tested: Inventory tracking system for shirt models and fabrics
user_persona: Customer Zoe is trying to select a limited edition fabric for her shirt.
user_goal: To choose an available fabric without encountering inventory issues.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Fabrics
narrative_steps.description: Zoe looks through the fabric options and notices one marked as low stock.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Low-stock fabrics display a warning indicator, and out-of-stock options are grayed out with a 'Out of Stock' label.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Fabric
narrative_steps.description: Zoe attempts to select a fabric that is out of stock.
narrative_steps.action: Click on an out-of-stock fabric swatch.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The selection is prevented and a notification suggests alternative fabric choices.

requirement_tested: Responsive design ensuring consistent experience across desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: Mobile user Charlie is customizing a shirt on his smartphone during lunch break.
user_goal: To navigate and customize a shirt seamlessly on a small touchscreen.

narrative_steps.title: Using Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Charlie accesses the customization page on his phone and interacts with the layout.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to simulate mobile view or use actual mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts responsively using media queries optimized for smaller screens, ensuring all touch targets meet minimum 44px spacing standards.
